outcomes.title: Line Slopes
outcomes.description: Identify the slope of a line from its equation.

exercises.pretext:
For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. -2 \, x + y = 7
  2. y = -3 \, x - 4
  1. \frac{1}{2}
  2. -3
exercises.html:
For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. \(-2 \, x + y = 7\)
  2. \(y = -3 \, x - 4\)

Answer:

  1. \(\frac{1}{2}\)
  2. \(-3\)

exercises.pretext:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. y = -7 \, x - 5
  2. -6 \, x + 7 \, y = \left(-8\right)
  1. -7
  2. \frac{7}{6}
exercises.html:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(y = -7 \, x - 5\)
  2. \(-6 \, x + 7 \, y = \left(-8\right)\)

Answer:

  1. \(-7\)
  2. \(\frac{7}{6}\)

exercises.pretext:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. y = 3 \, x + 1
  2. -8 \, x + 3 \, y = 0
  1. 3
  2. \frac{3}{8}
exercises.html:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(y = 3 \, x + 1\)
  2. \(-8 \, x + 3 \, y = 0\)

Answer:

  1. \(3\)
  2. \(\frac{3}{8}\)

exercises.pretext:
For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. 7 \, x + 8 \, y = \left(-7\right)
  2. y = -4 \, x + 9
  1. -\frac{8}{7}
  2. -4
exercises.html:
For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. \(7 \, x + 8 \, y = \left(-7\right)\)
  2. \(y = -4 \, x + 9\)

Answer:

  1. \(-\frac{8}{7}\)
  2. \(-4\)

exercises.pretext:
For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. y = -6 \, x - 2
  2. 5 \, x - 3 \, y = \left(-9\right)
  1. -6
  2. \frac{3}{5}
exercises.html:
For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. \(y = -6 \, x - 2\)
  2. \(5 \, x - 3 \, y = \left(-9\right)\)

Answer:

  1. \(-6\)
  2. \(\frac{3}{5}\)

exercises.pretext:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. y = -9 \, x
  2. -x + 5 \, y = \left(-3\right)
  1. -9
  2. 5
exercises.html:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(y = -9 \, x\)
  2. \(-x + 5 \, y = \left(-3\right)\)

Answer:

  1. \(-9\)
  2. \(5\)

exercises.pretext:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. y = -4 \, x - 1
  2. 7 \, x + 5 \, y = 4
  1. -4
  2. -\frac{5}{7}
exercises.html:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(y = -4 \, x - 1\)
  2. \(7 \, x + 5 \, y = 4\)

Answer:

  1. \(-4\)
  2. \(-\frac{5}{7}\)

exercises.pretext:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. y = -5 \, x - 1
  2. 9 \, x - 9 \, y = 7
  1. -5
  2. 1
exercises.html:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(y = -5 \, x - 1\)
  2. \(9 \, x - 9 \, y = 7\)

Answer:

  1. \(-5\)
  2. \(1\)

exercises.pretext:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. y = 2 \, x - 9
  2. -7 \, x + 7 \, y = 5
  1. 2
  2. 1
exercises.html:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(y = 2 \, x - 9\)
  2. \(-7 \, x + 7 \, y = 5\)

Answer:

  1. \(2\)
  2. \(1\)

exercises.pretext:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. 5 \, x - 6 \, y = 6
  2. y = -6 \, x + 8
  1. \frac{6}{5}
  2. -6
exercises.html:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(5 \, x - 6 \, y = 6\)
  2. \(y = -6 \, x + 8\)

Answer:

  1. \(\frac{6}{5}\)
  2. \(-6\)

exercises.pretext:
For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. 7 \, x + 8 \, y = \left(-7\right)
  2. y = x - 4
  1. -\frac{8}{7}
  2. 1
exercises.html:
For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. \(7 \, x + 8 \, y = \left(-7\right)\)
  2. \(y = x - 4\)

Answer:

  1. \(-\frac{8}{7}\)
  2. \(1\)

exercises.pretext:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. -8 \, x - 3 \, y = 5
  2. y = -5 \, x - 5
  1. -\frac{3}{8}
  2. -5
exercises.html:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(-8 \, x - 3 \, y = 5\)
  2. \(y = -5 \, x - 5\)

Answer:

  1. \(-\frac{3}{8}\)
  2. \(-5\)

exercises.pretext:
For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. y = 5 \, x + 9
  2. 8 \, x + 2 \, y = 6
  1. 5
  2. -\frac{1}{4}
exercises.html:
For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. \(y = 5 \, x + 9\)
  2. \(8 \, x + 2 \, y = 6\)

Answer:

  1. \(5\)
  2. \(-\frac{1}{4}\)

exercises.pretext:
For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. -4 \, x - 3 \, y = 2
  2. y = -8 \, x + 1
  1. -\frac{3}{4}
  2. -8
exercises.html:
For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. \(-4 \, x - 3 \, y = 2\)
  2. \(y = -8 \, x + 1\)

Answer:

  1. \(-\frac{3}{4}\)
  2. \(-8\)

exercises.pretext:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. -x - 8 \, y = \left(-2\right)
  2. y = 3 \, x + 9
  1. -8
  2. 3
exercises.html:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(-x - 8 \, y = \left(-2\right)\)
  2. \(y = 3 \, x + 9\)

Answer:

  1. \(-8\)
  2. \(3\)

exercises.pretext:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. y = 9 \, x - 3
  2. 4 \, x + 3 \, y = \left(-3\right)
  1. 9
  2. -\frac{3}{4}
exercises.html:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(y = 9 \, x - 3\)
  2. \(4 \, x + 3 \, y = \left(-3\right)\)

Answer:

  1. \(9\)
  2. \(-\frac{3}{4}\)

exercises.pretext:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. y = -6 \, x - 6
  2. -7 \, x - y = \left(-9\right)
  1. -6
  2. -\frac{1}{7}
exercises.html:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(y = -6 \, x - 6\)
  2. \(-7 \, x - y = \left(-9\right)\)

Answer:

  1. \(-6\)
  2. \(-\frac{1}{7}\)

exercises.pretext:
For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. y = 7 \, x - 9
  2. 8 \, x - 8 \, y = 0
  1. 7
  2. 1
exercises.html:
For each of the following line equations, identify its slope.

  1. \(y = 7 \, x - 9\)
  2. \(8 \, x - 8 \, y = 0\)

Answer:

  1. \(7\)
  2. \(1\)

exercises.pretext:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. y = -3 \, x - 9
  2. 6 \, x + 2 \, y = 5
  1. -3
  2. -\frac{1}{3}
exercises.html:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(y = -3 \, x - 9\)
  2. \(6 \, x + 2 \, y = 5\)

Answer:

  1. \(-3\)
  2. \(-\frac{1}{3}\)

exercises.pretext:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. 7 \, x + 9 \, y = 2
  2. y = 5 \, x - 5
  1. -\frac{9}{7}
  2. 5
exercises.html:
Identify the slope for each of the following line equations.

  1. \(7 \, x + 9 \, y = 2\)
  2. \(y = 5 \, x - 5\)

Answer:

  1. \(-\frac{9}{7}\)
  2. \(5\)

outcomes.title: Product Rule
outcomes.description: Apply the product rule to take derivatives

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the derivative f'(x).

f(x)=-4 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} f'(x)=-4 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} + 4 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right)
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-4 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=-4 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} + 4 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right) \]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the derivative f'(x).

f(x)=-3 \, x^{7} \cos\left(x\right) f'(x)=3 \, x^{7} \sin\left(x\right) - 21 \, x^{6} \cos\left(x\right)
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-3 \, x^{7} \cos\left(x\right) \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=3 \, x^{7} \sin\left(x\right) - 21 \, x^{6} \cos\left(x\right) \]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the rate of change f'(x).

f(x)=-4 \, \cos\left(x\right) \log\left(x\right) f'(x)=4 \, \log\left(x\right) \sin\left(x\right) - \frac{4 \, \cos\left(x\right)}{x}
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-4 \, \cos\left(x\right) \log\left(x\right) \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=4 \, \log\left(x\right) \sin\left(x\right) - \frac{4 \, \cos\left(x\right)}{x} \]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the derivative f'(x).

f(x)=-4 \, x^{8} \cos\left(x\right) f'(x)=4 \, x^{8} \sin\left(x\right) - 32 \, x^{7} \cos\left(x\right)
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-4 \, x^{8} \cos\left(x\right) \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=4 \, x^{8} \sin\left(x\right) - 32 \, x^{7} \cos\left(x\right) \]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the derivative f'(x).

f(x)=-3 \, x^{6} \sin\left(x\right) f'(x)=-3 \, x^{6} \cos\left(x\right) - 18 \, x^{5} \sin\left(x\right)
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-3 \, x^{6} \sin\left(x\right) \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=-3 \, x^{6} \cos\left(x\right) - 18 \, x^{5} \sin\left(x\right) \]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the derivative f'(x).

f(x)=-4 \, x^{2} \cos\left(x\right) f'(x)=4 \, x^{2} \sin\left(x\right) - 8 \, x \cos\left(x\right)
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-4 \, x^{2} \cos\left(x\right) \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=4 \, x^{2} \sin\left(x\right) - 8 \, x \cos\left(x\right) \]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the derivative f'(x).

f(x)=4 \, x^{8} e^{x} f'(x)=4 \, x^{8} e^{x} + 32 \, x^{7} e^{x}
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=4 \, x^{8} e^{x} \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=4 \, x^{8} e^{x} + 32 \, x^{7} e^{x} \]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the rate of change f'(x).

f(x)=2 \, x^{7} e^{x} f'(x)=2 \, x^{7} e^{x} + 14 \, x^{6} e^{x}
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=2 \, x^{7} e^{x} \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=2 \, x^{7} e^{x} + 14 \, x^{6} e^{x} \]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the rate of change f'(x).

f(x)=-4 \, x^{8} \cos\left(x\right) f'(x)=4 \, x^{8} \sin\left(x\right) - 32 \, x^{7} \cos\left(x\right)
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-4 \, x^{8} \cos\left(x\right) \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=4 \, x^{8} \sin\left(x\right) - 32 \, x^{7} \cos\left(x\right) \]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the derivative f'(x).

f(x)=4 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right) f'(x)=4 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} + 4 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right)
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=4 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right) \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=4 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} + 4 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right) \]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the derivative f'(x).

f(x)=-3 \, x^{8} \log\left(x\right) f'(x)=-24 \, x^{7} \log\left(x\right) - 3 \, x^{7}
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-3 \, x^{8} \log\left(x\right) \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=-24 \, x^{7} \log\left(x\right) - 3 \, x^{7} \]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the rate of change f'(x).

f(x)=-3 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} f'(x)=-3 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} + 3 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right)
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-3 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=-3 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} + 3 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right) \]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the rate of change f'(x).

f(x)=-3 \, x^{9} \cos\left(x\right) f'(x)=3 \, x^{9} \sin\left(x\right) - 27 \, x^{8} \cos\left(x\right)
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-3 \, x^{9} \cos\left(x\right) \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=3 \, x^{9} \sin\left(x\right) - 27 \, x^{8} \cos\left(x\right) \]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the rate of change f'(x).

f(x)=-2 \, \log\left(x\right) \sin\left(x\right) f'(x)=-2 \, \cos\left(x\right) \log\left(x\right) - \frac{2 \, \sin\left(x\right)}{x}
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-2 \, \log\left(x\right) \sin\left(x\right) \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=-2 \, \cos\left(x\right) \log\left(x\right) - \frac{2 \, \sin\left(x\right)}{x} \]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the rate of change f'(x).

f(x)=-3 \, \cos\left(x\right) \log\left(x\right) f'(x)=3 \, \log\left(x\right) \sin\left(x\right) - \frac{3 \, \cos\left(x\right)}{x}
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-3 \, \cos\left(x\right) \log\left(x\right) \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=3 \, \log\left(x\right) \sin\left(x\right) - \frac{3 \, \cos\left(x\right)}{x} \]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the rate of change f'(x).

f(x)=2 \, x^{5} \cos\left(x\right) f'(x)=-2 \, x^{5} \sin\left(x\right) + 10 \, x^{4} \cos\left(x\right)
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=2 \, x^{5} \cos\left(x\right) \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=-2 \, x^{5} \sin\left(x\right) + 10 \, x^{4} \cos\left(x\right) \]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the derivative f'(x).

f(x)=-3 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} f'(x)=-3 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} + 3 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right)
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=-3 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=-3 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} + 3 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right) \]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the rate of change f'(x).

f(x)=3 \, x^{9} \cos\left(x\right) f'(x)=-3 \, x^{9} \sin\left(x\right) + 27 \, x^{8} \cos\left(x\right)
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=3 \, x^{9} \cos\left(x\right) \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=-3 \, x^{9} \sin\left(x\right) + 27 \, x^{8} \cos\left(x\right) \]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the derivative f'(x).

f(x)=4 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right) f'(x)=4 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} + 4 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right)
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the derivative \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=4 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right) \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=4 \, \cos\left(x\right) e^{x} + 4 \, e^{x} \sin\left(x\right) \]

exercises.pretext:
Explain how to find the rate of change f'(x).

f(x)=2 \, x^{8} \log\left(x\right) f'(x)=16 \, x^{7} \log\left(x\right) + 2 \, x^{7}
exercises.html:
Explain how to find the rate of change \(f'(x)\).

\[ f(x)=2 \, x^{8} \log\left(x\right) \]

Answer:

\[ f'(x)=16 \, x^{7} \log\left(x\right) + 2 \, x^{7} \]

outcomes.title: Matrix Example
outcomes.description: Write equivalent matrices, linear systems, and vector equations.

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} 4 \, x_{1} & + & 4 \, x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & + & 18 \, x_{4} & = & -11 \\ -3 \, x_{1} & - & 3 \, x_{2} & + & x_{3} & - & 7 \, x_{4} & = & 5 \\ 3 \, x_{1} & + & 3 \, x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & + & 15 \, x_{4} & = & -9 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrrr|r} 4 & 4 & 3 & 18 & -11 \\ -3 & -3 & 1 & -7 & 5 \\ 3 & 3 & 3 & 15 & -9 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} 4 \, x_{1} & + & 4 \, x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & + & 18 \, x_{4} & = & -11 \\ -3 \, x_{1} & - & 3 \, x_{2} & + & x_{3} & - & 7 \, x_{4} & = & 5 \\ 3 \, x_{1} & + & 3 \, x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & + & 15 \, x_{4} & = & -9 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrrr|r} 4 & 4 & 3 & 18 & -11 \\ -3 & -3 & 1 & -7 & 5 \\ 3 & 3 & 3 & 15 & -9 \end{array}\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} -3 \, x_{1} & - & x_{2} & + & 7 \, x_{3} & = & 4 \\ -3 \, x_{1} & - & 5 \, x_{2} & - & x_{3} & = & -4 \\ 4 \, x_{1} & + & 3 \, x_{2} & - & 6 \, x_{3} & = & -2 \\ -x_{1} & - & x_{2} & + & x_{3} & = & 0 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} -3 & -1 & 7 & 4 \\ -3 & -5 & -1 & -4 \\ 4 & 3 & -6 & -2 \\ -1 & -1 & 1 & 0 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} -3 \, x_{1} & - & x_{2} & + & 7 \, x_{3} & = & 4 \\ -3 \, x_{1} & - & 5 \, x_{2} & - & x_{3} & = & -4 \\ 4 \, x_{1} & + & 3 \, x_{2} & - & 6 \, x_{3} & = & -2 \\ -x_{1} & - & x_{2} & + & x_{3} & = & 0 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} -3 & -1 & 7 & 4 \\ -3 & -5 & -1 & -4 \\ 4 & 3 & -6 & -2 \\ -1 & -1 & 1 & 0 \end{array}\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} -5 \, x_{1} & - & 3 \, x_{2} & + & 18 \, x_{3} & = & -14 \\ -3 \, x_{1} & - & 2 \, x_{2} & + & 11 \, x_{3} & = & -9 \\ -x_{1} & + & 3 \, x_{2} & & & = & 8 \\ & - & x_{2} & + & x_{3} & = & -3 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} -5 & -3 & 18 & -14 \\ -3 & -2 & 11 & -9 \\ -1 & 3 & 0 & 8 \\ 0 & -1 & 1 & -3 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} -5 \, x_{1} & - & 3 \, x_{2} & + & 18 \, x_{3} & = & -14 \\ -3 \, x_{1} & - & 2 \, x_{2} & + & 11 \, x_{3} & = & -9 \\ -x_{1} & + & 3 \, x_{2} & & & = & 8 \\ & - & x_{2} & + & x_{3} & = & -3 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} -5 & -3 & 18 & -14 \\ -3 & -2 & 11 & -9 \\ -1 & 3 & 0 & 8 \\ 0 & -1 & 1 & -3 \end{array}\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} x & - & y & + & 4 \, z & = & 4 \\ 2 \, x & - & y & + & 4 \, z & = & 7 \\ & - & y & + & 5 \, z & = & 1 \\ & & & - & 2 \, z & = & 0 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} 1 & -1 & 4 & 4 \\ 2 & -1 & 4 & 7 \\ 0 & -1 & 5 & 1 \\ 0 & 0 & -2 & 0 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x & - & y & + & 4 \, z & = & 4 \\ 2 \, x & - & y & + & 4 \, z & = & 7 \\ & - & y & + & 5 \, z & = & 1 \\ & & & - & 2 \, z & = & 0 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} 1 & -1 & 4 & 4 \\ 2 & -1 & 4 & 7 \\ 0 & -1 & 5 & 1 \\ 0 & 0 & -2 & 0 \end{array}\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} x & & & + & 2 \, z & = & 3 \\ -2 \, x & + & y & - & 5 \, z & = & -2 \\ -3 \, x & + & y & - & 7 \, z & = & -4 \\ -2 \, x & + & y & - & 5 \, z & = & -5 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} 1 & 0 & 2 & 3 \\ -2 & 1 & -5 & -2 \\ -3 & 1 & -7 & -4 \\ -2 & 1 & -5 & -5 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x & & & + & 2 \, z & = & 3 \\ -2 \, x & + & y & - & 5 \, z & = & -2 \\ -3 \, x & + & y & - & 7 \, z & = & -4 \\ -2 \, x & + & y & - & 5 \, z & = & -5 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} 1 & 0 & 2 & 3 \\ -2 & 1 & -5 & -2 \\ -3 & 1 & -7 & -4 \\ -2 & 1 & -5 & -5 \end{array}\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} -2 \, x_{1} & + & 6 \, x_{2} & - & 6 \, x_{3} & - & 2 \, x_{4} & = & 4 \\ 3 \, x_{1} & - & 9 \, x_{2} & + & 9 \, x_{3} & + & x_{4} & = & 0 \\ -3 \, x_{1} & + & 9 \, x_{2} & - & 9 \, x_{3} & - & 2 \, x_{4} & = & 3 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrrr|r} -2 & 6 & -6 & -2 & 4 \\ 3 & -9 & 9 & 1 & 0 \\ -3 & 9 & -9 & -2 & 3 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} -2 \, x_{1} & + & 6 \, x_{2} & - & 6 \, x_{3} & - & 2 \, x_{4} & = & 4 \\ 3 \, x_{1} & - & 9 \, x_{2} & + & 9 \, x_{3} & + & x_{4} & = & 0 \\ -3 \, x_{1} & + & 9 \, x_{2} & - & 9 \, x_{3} & - & 2 \, x_{4} & = & 3 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrrr|r} -2 & 6 & -6 & -2 & 4 \\ 3 & -9 & 9 & 1 & 0 \\ -3 & 9 & -9 & -2 & 3 \end{array}\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} x_{1} & + & 3 \, x_{2} & - & 2 \, x_{3} & = & 3 \\ -x_{1} & - & 3 \, x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & = & -2 \\ & & & - & 5 \, x_{3} & = & -4 \\ -x_{1} & - & 3 \, x_{2} & + & x_{3} & = & -3 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} 1 & 3 & -2 & 3 \\ -1 & -3 & 3 & -2 \\ 0 & 0 & -5 & -4 \\ -1 & -3 & 1 & -3 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x_{1} & + & 3 \, x_{2} & - & 2 \, x_{3} & = & 3 \\ -x_{1} & - & 3 \, x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & = & -2 \\ & & & - & 5 \, x_{3} & = & -4 \\ -x_{1} & - & 3 \, x_{2} & + & x_{3} & = & -3 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} 1 & 3 & -2 & 3 \\ -1 & -3 & 3 & -2 \\ 0 & 0 & -5 & -4 \\ -1 & -3 & 1 & -3 \end{array}\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} x & - & y & + & 4 \, z & = & 7 \\ x & & & + & 3 \, z & = & 7 \\ -x & - & 3 \, y & + & z & = & -5 \\ 2 \, x & - & y & + & 3 \, z & = & 6 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} 1 & -1 & 4 & 7 \\ 1 & 0 & 3 & 7 \\ -1 & -3 & 1 & -5 \\ 2 & -1 & 3 & 6 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x & - & y & + & 4 \, z & = & 7 \\ x & & & + & 3 \, z & = & 7 \\ -x & - & 3 \, y & + & z & = & -5 \\ 2 \, x & - & y & + & 3 \, z & = & 6 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} 1 & -1 & 4 & 7 \\ 1 & 0 & 3 & 7 \\ -1 & -3 & 1 & -5 \\ 2 & -1 & 3 & 6 \end{array}\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} -4 \, x_{1} & - & 4 \, x_{2} & - & x_{3} & = & -5 \\ 5 \, x_{1} & + & 5 \, x_{2} & + & x_{3} & = & 7 \\ -4 \, x_{1} & - & 4 \, x_{2} & + & 2 \, x_{3} & = & -14 \\ 2 \, x_{1} & + & 2 \, x_{2} & + & 4 \, x_{3} & = & -8 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} -4 & -4 & -1 & -5 \\ 5 & 5 & 1 & 7 \\ -4 & -4 & 2 & -14 \\ 2 & 2 & 4 & -8 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} -4 \, x_{1} & - & 4 \, x_{2} & - & x_{3} & = & -5 \\ 5 \, x_{1} & + & 5 \, x_{2} & + & x_{3} & = & 7 \\ -4 \, x_{1} & - & 4 \, x_{2} & + & 2 \, x_{3} & = & -14 \\ 2 \, x_{1} & + & 2 \, x_{2} & + & 4 \, x_{3} & = & -8 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} -4 & -4 & -1 & -5 \\ 5 & 5 & 1 & 7 \\ -4 & -4 & 2 & -14 \\ 2 & 2 & 4 & -8 \end{array}\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} -x_{1} & & & + & 3 \, x_{3} & = & -11 \\ 3 \, x_{1} & + & x_{2} & - & x_{3} & = & 6 \\ -2 \, x_{1} & & & + & 5 \, x_{3} & = & -19 \\ & & & & 2 \, x_{3} & = & -6 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} -1 & 0 & 3 & -11 \\ 3 & 1 & -1 & 6 \\ -2 & 0 & 5 & -19 \\ 0 & 0 & 2 & -6 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} -x_{1} & & & + & 3 \, x_{3} & = & -11 \\ 3 \, x_{1} & + & x_{2} & - & x_{3} & = & 6 \\ -2 \, x_{1} & & & + & 5 \, x_{3} & = & -19 \\ & & & & 2 \, x_{3} & = & -6 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} -1 & 0 & 3 & -11 \\ 3 & 1 & -1 & 6 \\ -2 & 0 & 5 & -19 \\ 0 & 0 & 2 & -6 \end{array}\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} x_{1} & & & - & 3 \, x_{3} & = & 6 \\ & & x_{2} & - & 4 \, x_{3} & = & 12 \\ 4 \, x_{1} & + & x_{2} & + & 5 \, x_{3} & = & -27 \\ & & & - & 5 \, x_{3} & = & 15 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} 1 & 0 & -3 & 6 \\ 0 & 1 & -4 & 12 \\ 4 & 1 & 5 & -27 \\ 0 & 0 & -5 & 15 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x_{1} & & & - & 3 \, x_{3} & = & 6 \\ & & x_{2} & - & 4 \, x_{3} & = & 12 \\ 4 \, x_{1} & + & x_{2} & + & 5 \, x_{3} & = & -27 \\ & & & - & 5 \, x_{3} & = & 15 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} 1 & 0 & -3 & 6 \\ 0 & 1 & -4 & 12 \\ 4 & 1 & 5 & -27 \\ 0 & 0 & -5 & 15 \end{array}\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} x & + & 2 \, y & - & 3 \, z & = & -7 \\ 2 \, x & + & 4 \, y & - & 5 \, z & = & -12 \\ -x & - & 2 \, y & & & = & 1 \\ & & & - & 3 \, z & = & -6 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} 1 & 2 & -3 & -7 \\ 2 & 4 & -5 & -12 \\ -1 & -2 & 0 & 1 \\ 0 & 0 & -3 & -6 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x & + & 2 \, y & - & 3 \, z & = & -7 \\ 2 \, x & + & 4 \, y & - & 5 \, z & = & -12 \\ -x & - & 2 \, y & & & = & 1 \\ & & & - & 3 \, z & = & -6 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} 1 & 2 & -3 & -7 \\ 2 & 4 & -5 & -12 \\ -1 & -2 & 0 & 1 \\ 0 & 0 & -3 & -6 \end{array}\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} x_{1} & & & - & 2 \, x_{3} & = & 0 \\ & & x_{2} & - & 3 \, x_{3} & = & -4 \\ x_{1} & & & - & 2 \, x_{3} & = & 1 \\ -2 \, x_{1} & + & x_{2} & + & x_{3} & = & -3 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} 1 & 0 & -2 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 & -3 & -4 \\ 1 & 0 & -2 & 1 \\ -2 & 1 & 1 & -3 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x_{1} & & & - & 2 \, x_{3} & = & 0 \\ & & x_{2} & - & 3 \, x_{3} & = & -4 \\ x_{1} & & & - & 2 \, x_{3} & = & 1 \\ -2 \, x_{1} & + & x_{2} & + & x_{3} & = & -3 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} 1 & 0 & -2 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 & -3 & -4 \\ 1 & 0 & -2 & 1 \\ -2 & 1 & 1 & -3 \end{array}\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} x_{1} & + & 2 \, x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & - & x_{4} & = & 4 \\ & & & & & & 0 & = & 1 \\ & & & & & & 0 & = & -3 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrrr|r} 1 & 2 & 3 & -1 & 4 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & 1 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & -3 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x_{1} & + & 2 \, x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & - & x_{4} & = & 4 \\ & & & & & & 0 & = & 1 \\ & & & & & & 0 & = & -3 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrrr|r} 1 & 2 & 3 & -1 & 4 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & 1 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & -3 \end{array}\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} x & - & 3 \, y & + & z & - & 3 \, {w} & = & 4 \\ & & & & & & {w} & = & -2 \\ & & & & & - & 2 \, {w} & = & 4 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrrr|r} 1 & -3 & 1 & -3 & 4 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 & 1 & -2 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 & -2 & 4 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x & - & 3 \, y & + & z & - & 3 \, {w} & = & 4 \\ & & & & & & {w} & = & -2 \\ & & & & & - & 2 \, {w} & = & 4 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrrr|r} 1 & -3 & 1 & -3 & 4 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 & 1 & -2 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 & -2 & 4 \end{array}\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} x & & & - & z & - & 3 \, {w} & = & -3 \\ & & y & + & 5 \, z & + & 13 \, {w} & = & 12 \\ x & - & y & - & 5 \, z & - & 13 \, {w} & = & -12 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrrr|r} 1 & 0 & -1 & -3 & -3 \\ 0 & 1 & 5 & 13 & 12 \\ 1 & -1 & -5 & -13 & -12 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x & & & - & z & - & 3 \, {w} & = & -3 \\ & & y & + & 5 \, z & + & 13 \, {w} & = & 12 \\ x & - & y & - & 5 \, z & - & 13 \, {w} & = & -12 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrrr|r} 1 & 0 & -1 & -3 & -3 \\ 0 & 1 & 5 & 13 & 12 \\ 1 & -1 & -5 & -13 & -12 \end{array}\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} x & + & y & - & 3 \, z & = & 12 \\ & & & & z & = & -3 \\ & & & - & 5 \, z & = & 15 \\ -x & - & y & + & 5 \, z & = & -18 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} 1 & 1 & -3 & 12 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 & -3 \\ 0 & 0 & -5 & 15 \\ -1 & -1 & 5 & -18 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} x & + & y & - & 3 \, z & = & 12 \\ & & & & z & = & -3 \\ & & & - & 5 \, z & = & 15 \\ -x & - & y & + & 5 \, z & = & -18 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} 1 & 1 & -3 & 12 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 & -3 \\ 0 & 0 & -5 & 15 \\ -1 & -1 & 5 & -18 \end{array}\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} -2 \, x_{1} & - & x_{2} & + & 5 \, x_{3} & = & -10 \\ -x_{1} & - & x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & = & -6 \\ & - & 2 \, x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & = & -5 \\ -2 \, x_{1} & & & + & 5 \, x_{3} & = & -9 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} -2 & -1 & 5 & -10 \\ -1 & -1 & 3 & -6 \\ 0 & -2 & 3 & -5 \\ -2 & 0 & 5 & -9 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} -2 \, x_{1} & - & x_{2} & + & 5 \, x_{3} & = & -10 \\ -x_{1} & - & x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & = & -6 \\ & - & 2 \, x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & = & -5 \\ -2 \, x_{1} & & & + & 5 \, x_{3} & = & -9 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} -2 & -1 & 5 & -10 \\ -1 & -1 & 3 & -6 \\ 0 & -2 & 3 & -5 \\ -2 & 0 & 5 & -9 \end{array}\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} -x_{1} & - & 2 \, x_{2} & - & x_{3} & = & 3 \\ x_{1} & - & 2 \, x_{2} & - & 2 \, x_{3} & = & 3 \\ -x_{1} & + & x_{2} & + & x_{3} & = & -2 \\ -2 \, x_{1} & + & x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & = & 1 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} -1 & -2 & -1 & 3 \\ 1 & -2 & -2 & 3 \\ -1 & 1 & 1 & -2 \\ -2 & 1 & 3 & 1 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} -x_{1} & - & 2 \, x_{2} & - & x_{3} & = & 3 \\ x_{1} & - & 2 \, x_{2} & - & 2 \, x_{3} & = & 3 \\ -x_{1} & + & x_{2} & + & x_{3} & = & -2 \\ -2 \, x_{1} & + & x_{2} & + & 3 \, x_{3} & = & 1 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} -1 & -2 & -1 & 3 \\ 1 & -2 & -2 & 3 \\ -1 & 1 & 1 & -2 \\ -2 & 1 & 3 & 1 \end{array}\right)\]

exercises.pretext:
Consider the following system of equations:

\begin{matrix} -x_{1} & - & 2 \, x_{2} & - & 3 \, x_{3} & = & 3 \\ -x_{1} & - & 2 \, x_{2} & - & 4 \, x_{3} & = & 4 \\ -x_{1} & - & 2 \, x_{2} & & & = & 1 \\ & & & & x_{3} & = & 2 \\ \end{matrix}

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

 \left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} -1 & -2 & -3 & 3 \\ -1 & -2 & -4 & 4 \\ -1 & -2 & 0 & 1 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 & 2 \end{array}\right)
exercises.html:
Consider the following system of equations:

\[\begin{matrix} -x_{1} & - & 2 \, x_{2} & - & 3 \, x_{3} & = & 3 \\ -x_{1} & - & 2 \, x_{2} & - & 4 \, x_{3} & = & 4 \\ -x_{1} & - & 2 \, x_{2} & & & = & 1 \\ & & & & x_{3} & = & 2 \\ \end{matrix}\]

Write an augmented matrix corresponding to this system.

Answer:

\[\left(\begin{array}{rrr|r} -1 & -2 & -3 & 3 \\ -1 & -2 & -4 & 4 \\ -1 & -2 & 0 & 1 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 & 2 \end{array}\right)\]
